messages.body:
$VMW VMware collaborates with Samsung Electronics for 5G development 

https://newsfilter.io/a/1776927d8190b1c5c7f0e9e194ae262c

links.title: VMware collaborates with Samsung Electronics for 5G development
links.description: VMware and Samsung Electronics form alliance to accelerate communication service providers' transformation to 5G.The companies to help communication service providers meet the requirements of 5G networks and accelerate the roll-out of 5G by optimizing SSNLF's portfolio of telco offerings from Core to Edge to RAN for both containerized network functions and virtualized network functions with VMware Telco Cloud Platform.As part of this collaboration, the companies have been working together at Samsung's lab to optimize and accelerate the readiness of Samsung's various VNFs and CNFs.

messages.body: $VMW VMware and Samsung Form Alliance to Accelerate Communication Service Providers’ Transformation to 5G https://www.otcdynamics.com/vmw-vmware-and-samsung-form-alliance-to-accelerate-communication-service-providers-transformation-to-5g

links.title: $VMW VMware and Samsung Form Alliance to Accelerate Communication Service Providers' Transformation to 5G
links.description: VMware, Inc. (NYSE: VMW) today announced it has collaborated with Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. to further extend its leadership in 5G. Through this alliance, the companies seek to help Communication Service Providers (CSPs) meet the requirements of 5G networks and accelerate the roll-out of 5G by optimizing Samsung's portfolio of telco offerings from Core to Edge to RAN for both containerized network functions (CNFs) and virtualized network functions (VNFs) with VMware Telco Cloud Platform.

links.title: Conference Call Transcripts
links.description: Get notified next time VMW.US makes a similar move! Patrick P Gelsinger, Vmware's Chief Executive Officer and a director of the company, recently disposed of 6,426 shares of the company. The disposals took place at $0.00 per share, on October 15, 2020. Gelsinger still owns 588,688 shares of the company.

messages.body:
$VMW VMware price target raised to $180 from $170 at KeyBanc
KeyBanc analyst Alex Kurtz raised the firm's price target on VMware to $180 from $170 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares. The analyst notes that the Q3 KBCM IT VAR Survey provides a constructive view on 2021 spending, which he sees as a net positive to a company like VMware that has access to many spending silos within a Global 2K's IT budgeting process. Given the breadth and maturity of VMware's installed base, the model is historically more sensitive to the global demand outlook than many of its smaller competitors, Kurtz contends.
